title: Rolling - linear position and angular acceleration

content.description: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a rigid wheel begins to roll across a surface without slipping. The linear position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> </math> of the wheel’s center of mass is given by <math alttext="x of t equals uppercase A, t cubed" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> is a positive constant. The angular acceleration <math alttext="alpha" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> of the wheel is given by <math alttext="alpha of t equals 2 times t" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.
